contentrichtext.text: {{Expand German|date=August 2011|Jonas Furrer}} {{Infobox Politician | name=Jonas Furrer | image=Jonas_Furrer.jpg | width = 150px | office=[[Member of the Swiss Federal Council]] | term_start=1848 | term_end=1861 | birth_date={{birth date|1805|3|3|mf=y}} | birth_place=[[Winterthur]] | death_date={{death date and age|1861|7|25|1805|3|3|mf=y}} | death_place=[[Bad Ragaz]] |}} '''Jonas Furrer''' (March 3, 1805 – July 25, 1861) was a [[Switzerland|Swiss]] politician and member of the [[Swiss Federal Council]] (1848–1861). He was affiliated to the [[Free Democratic Party of Switzerland|Radical Party]]. ==Biography== After studying at [[Zürich]], [[University of Heidelberg|Heidelberg]] and [[University of Göttingen|Göttingen]],<ref name=ea/> he was elected to the Grand Council of Switzerland ({{lang-de|[[:de:Kantonsparlament|Kantonsparlament]]}}) in 1834, where he was president in 1837 and 1839. In 1845 he became president of the cantonal diet ({{lang-de|[[:de:Kantonsregierung|Kantonsregierung]]}}) of Zürich. He was [[President of the Swiss Diet]] from April 2, 1845, to December 31, 1845. He was elected to the Federal Council on November 16, 1848, as one of the seven initial members. During his time in office, he presided over the following departments: *[[Political Department]] (1848–1849) *[[Department of Justice and Police]] (1850–1851) *[[Political Department]] (1852) *[[Department of Justice and Police]] (1853–1854) *[[Political Department]] (1855) *[[Department of Justice and Police]] (1856–1857) *[[Political Department]] (1858) *[[Department of Justice and Police]] (1859–1861) He was the first [[president of the Confederation (Switzerland)|president of the Confederation]] from November 21, 1848, to December 31, 1849, and again in 1852, 1855 and 1858. Furrer died in office on July 25, 1861. He wrote ''Das Erbrecht der Stadt Winterthur'' (“Inheritance law in the city of Winterthur,” 1832).<ref name=ea>{{Cite Americana|wstitle=Furrer, Jonas}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category|Jonas Furrer}} *{{Swiss Federal Councillor|1}} *{{HDS|3637}} {{s-start}} {{succession box | before = none (The first) | title = [[President of the Swiss Council of States|President of the Council of States]] | years = 1848 | after = [[François Briatte]]}} {{succession box | before = n/a one of the first seven | title = [[Member of the Swiss Federal Council]] | years = 1848–1861 | after = [[Jakob Dubs]]}} {{s-end}} {{Presidents of the Swiss Confederation}} {{Authority control|VIAF=64412774}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Furrer, Jonas | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Swiss politician | DATE OF BIRTH = March 3, 1805 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Winterthur]] | DATE OF DEATH = July 25, 1861 | PLACE OF DEATH = [[Bad Ragaz]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Furrer, Jonas}} [[Category:1805 births]] [[Category:1861 deaths]] [[Category:People from Winterthur]] [[Category:Members of the Swiss Federal Council]] [[Category:Mayors of Zurich]] [[Category:University of Zurich alumni]] {{Switzerland-mayor-stub}}
